node.title: Nationals MP James Hayward fronts parliament for first time since child sex charges laid
node.alt: A man with short red hair and a dark jumper walking with a woman with blonde hair
node.description: Former Nationals MP James Hayward, who has been charged with child sex abuse, briefly attendsÂ parliament, allowing him to keep his seat and salary.
node.content:
["A former WA Nationals MP\u00a0who has resigned from the party following child sex abuse charges\u00a0has returned to state parliament.", "James Hayward briefly walked into the Legislative Council at about 8pm on Tuesday to mark his attendance before leaving.\u00a0", "The brief attendance will allow Mr Hayward to keep his seat and his salary.", "The 52-year-old MP's National Party membership was suspended after he was charged by police last week with child sexual abuse offences in relation to an eight-year-old girl.", "Earlier on Tuesday, officers from the Child Abuse Squad attended Parliament House as part of their ongoing investigation.", "", "
Nationals WA leader Mia Davies has said\u00a0James Hayward's position in parliament is untenable.(ABC News: Roxanne Taylor)
", "Mr Hayward appeared in Perth Magistrates Court last week charged with three counts of indecent dealings with a child, one count of procuring a child to do an indecent act and one count of persistent sexual conduct.", "He was granted bail with a $30,000 surety, including strict conditions including that he report five times a week to police and that he not have any unsupervised contact with children under 16.", "WA Nationals leader Mia Davies last week said his position in parliament was untenable."]
